summary: Prague, the capital city of the Czech Republic, is classified under the category of "regions of EU Member States" within the Eurovoc thesaurus. As a significant urban center, it plays a vital role in the socio-economic landscape of the European Union. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, Prague is often referenced in discussions regarding regional development, cohesion policy, and urban governance. Its status as a major hub for political, cultural, and economic activities makes it a focal point for EU initiatives aimed at enhancing regional integration and promoting sustainable development across member states.
